frame.name: Intentional_traversing
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Self_mover</fen> intentionally moves in a <fen>Direction</fen>on a <fen>Path</fen> relative to landmark that is neither the <fen>Source</fen> nor the <fen>Goal</fen> of the overall motion. The shape or configuration of the <fen>Path</fen> may be expressed with a <fen>Path_shape</fen>
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">Ambrose Powell</fex> <t>forded</t> <fex name="Path">over</fex> <fex name="Means_of_motion">on one horse</fex>, and we drove the others after him.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">We</fex> repassed the first day's battlefield and <t>ascended</t> <fex name="Path">the road to the city</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">Jeff Manor and I</fex> <t>climbed</t> <fex name="Path">the North Face of Mt Shuksan</fex>, <fex name="cir">with cold, clear weather and solid ice</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Self_mover
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">We</fex> drive down dusty roads, <t>forded</t> through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
<ex>We <t>forded</t> <fex name="Src">from the island</fex> to the mainland.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
<ex>We decided to <t>cut</t> <fex name="Path">through the forest</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>I'll <t>cut</t> across the Sahara desert <fex name="Goal">up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (<ment>hard</ment>, <ment>softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Self_mover</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>Immediately, the monk invited her to sit on his shoulders and he <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>forded</t> the river, depositing her on the opposite bank.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Distance</fen>.
<ex>He followed the coast as far as Fronteras, then <t>cut</t> <fex name="Dist">160 miles</fex> across the Gulf of Mexico to the Yucat√°n Peninsula.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event involving the <fen>Self_mover</fen> that results in their moving in the specified way.
<ex>The enemy had <t>forded</t> the river <fex name="Mns">by piling up the bodies of their fallen comrades in the river bed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves.
<ex>Motorists once again must <fex name="Speed">quickly</fex> <t>cut</t> across three lanes of traffic to get from Exit 7 to Exit 8.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cotheme
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique, relative to which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves.
<ex>They <t>cut</t> across the bushes <fex name="Thm_c">after him</fex> and watched him Go into a small shrine-like building at the very center of the compound</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
<ex>I actually <t>forded</t> the river <fex name="Dep-Und">in my ski boots</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
<ex>The common brook is best <t>forded</t> <fex name="Place">south of the hut</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path_shape
FE.definition: <def-root>The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously. </def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
<ex>We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then <t>cut</t> <fex name="dir">west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the motion takes place.
<ex>The Federal Army of the Potomac <t>forded</t> the river <fex name="Time">in August 1862</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> wishes to bring about.
<ex>I <t>cut</t> through the alley in order <fex name="Purpose">to escape my pursuers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means_of_motion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The device or bodypart that serves to move the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
<ex>The General was received by Colonel Thayer, and <t>ascended</t> the hill <fex name="Means_of_motion">in a landau</fex>, escorted by the officers of the post.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> spends in motion.
<ex>We <t>forded</t> Cooper Cr. <fex name="dur">for several hours</fex> then built a fire to dry out gear.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
<ex>Streams were <t>forded</t> <fex name="Explanation">because there were no bridges over meandering Back Creek</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time the Intentional_traversing occurs and which the Intentional_traversing is taken to be a part of.
<ex>He had comfortably <t>forded</t> it <fex name="Containing_event">on his trip to Beatrice</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that an action occurs in a given time.
<ex>Early in the morning, Chapman had <fex name="Frequency">twice</fex> <t>forded</t> the river a short distance north of the footbridge.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition:
<def-root>A larger conceptualization that includes the Intentional_traversing as an integral part. The Intentional_traversing expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization.
<ex>The 133rd Infantry hurriedly <t>forded</t> the river <fex name="Re-encoding">in an attempt to capture a bridge intact</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: New_situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the <fen>Self_mover</fen>), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the Intentional_traversing.
<ex>I <t>cut</t> across Arnold's new backyard <fex name="New_situation">only to find literally hundreds of squirrels everywhere</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Traversing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole.
<ex>These waterways can be <t>forded</t> by infantry <fex name="cir">at low water</fex>, but at other times a six-foot tide makes them difficult to cross.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Endpoints
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen> of either a single or a repeated motion taken together as <fen>Endpoints</fen> of the <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex>It is located at the place where explorers Marquette and Jolliet <t>forded</t> <fex name="Endpoints">between the Chicago and Des Plaines Rivers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Co-participant</fen> is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the primary protagonist, regardless of whether the protagonist, and hence the <fen>Co-participant</fen>, is more agent- or more undergoer-like.
<ex>John <t>forded</t> the river <fex name="Co-participant">with his cousin</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: ford.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cross a stream at a shallow place

lexUnit.name: cut.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to go directly across rather than around an area

lexUnit.name: climb.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: traverse an inclined surface so as to rise in elevation

lexUnit.name: ascend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move up an inclined surface
